The solution of equation (8) gives the bearing stress diagram, AP being equal to 447.4 and DP equal to 31.5.

blocks.title: Example 114—To find an expression for the maximum intensity of shearing stress in beams.

blocks.caption: Figure 114—Shearing Stress in Beams.
blocks.description: The figure illustrates the relationship between the shear force and the maximum shearing stress at a given section of a beam, indicating the manner in which shear forces affect the internal stress distribution.

blocks.text: The maximum shear stress at a point in a vertical section of a beam is always accompanied by shearing stresses due to external loading. If the resultant force acting on the point is denoted as $D=\text{M}^2=4M$, then the total pushing forces on DP = total pushing forces on CE, the difference being the tangential forces on CE.
